bibl.title: Robert Ross v. David M. Littlefield. Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court Third Judicial District. Holding Terms at Port Townsend

body.p: Territory of Washington } ss County of Jefferson

The grand jury of the Territory of Washington for the body of the 3rd judicial district empowered charged and sworn, on the 3' day of September 1867. John M. Izett foreman D.R. Broson was apprehended J.K. Kennedy Esq. prosecuting attorney for said district. Presented the case of the Territory of Washington s.s. george washington to Michael Williams. Robert Ross sworn by the foreman said that he was present on the 27 day of June 1867 and saw at on bord of the Barque , after six oclock on that day. Michael Williams brought the supper forward all hand was present except George Washington who came last, he asked if there was no salt beef, some one said there was salt beef at the gally any worker could get it, I am not posative who asked the made the remark, then Washington asked who brought the supper forward, someone answered that Williams the prisoner did, then Washington called the prisoner a black Bastard, Williams made no reply, Washington then went to the gally and came forward with Beef in one hand, and his knife in the other,

and called called Williams a black bastard again, Williams rose from his meal dropping his knife from his hand and said george do you mean that? Washington said he did, then g heard what sounded to and and to be a blow in the face on looking, saw them clenched. They wrestled and fell, Williams on top, Washington turned Williams taking him by the with one hand, and shaking him in the face with the other. Williams sung out Washington was his thumb, I told Williams to say enough and we would take him off, Williams then sung out that he was whiped that way of fighting, Washington then bet him up and went forward, and Williams followed, I stoped Williams, telling him he should not go forward, he said he would, he went of finally "I then saw him go forward, but saw nothing in his hand. I took particular notice, nor do I believe he had a knife". I then sat down to supper. presently some one said he is stabbing him, Washington. "When I rose I could I did not see Williams and Washington together after that". I never saw Williams running off on the stabbard side and

I saw on the port side to keep him from getting on shore. " I did not see any knife on Williams when he was going forward. The last time - I did not see Williams strike Washington with a knife at any time".
Signed by the above named Robert Ross, in the Grand Jury room Port Townsend, Sep 3rd, 1867,
John M. Izett Forman Grand Jury
